title.value: Realizing XR Applications Using 5G-Based 3D Holographic Communication and Mobile Edge Computing
title.quote: Realizing XR Applications Using 5G-Based 3D Holographic Communication and Mobile Edge Computing

extractions.description: The paper proposes a novel job scheduling algorithm that leverages Mobile Edge Computing (MEC) servers to minimize total latency in 3D holographic communication, aiming to enhance the user experience in various XR applications.

type.justification: The paper presents extensive experiments to evaluate the performance of the proposed algorithm in terms of latency reduction, involving a practical scenario with Augmented Reality (AR).
type.quote: We conduct extensive experiments to evaluate the performance of our algorithm in terms of latency reduction, and the results demonstrate that our approach significantly outperforms other baseline methods.

name.justification: The paper focuses on XR applications involving 3D holographic communication, highlighting its potential to revolutionize user interaction in virtual spaces.
name.quote: 3D holographic communication has the potential to revolutionize the way people interact with each other in virtual spaces, offering immersive and realistic experiences.

name.justification: The paper mentions the importance of incorporating XR applications such as VR, AR, and MR to enhance user experiences.
name.quote: The seamless integration of holographic communication into XR applications such as VR, AR, and MR dramatically enhances the user experience by providing high realism, depth perception, and interactivity.

name.justification: The paper presents a practical scenario involving Augmented Reality (AR) to illustrate the applicability and importance of the proposed algorithm.
name.quote: Furthermore, we present a practical scenario involving Augmented Reality (AR), which not only illustrates the applicability of our algorithm but also highlights the importance of minimizing latency in achieving high-quality holographic views.
